triples.evidence: Instead of laser excitation, we use X-rays, and the resulting emitted light can be collected optically.
This material, when irradiated by X-rays, stores the energy and then later emits near-infrared light when stimulated by low-energy light.

evidence: This material, when irradiated by X-rays, stores the energy and then later emits near-infrared light when stimulated by low-energy light.
Instead of laser excitation, we use X-rays, and the resulting emitted light can be collected optically. That's the core idea behind X-ray Optical Coupling.
